TopicTitle: heatConductivity is commented out on most parts' .cfgs

Articles.Content: On all the stock part.cfgs I have seen, the value heatConductivity is set, but the line is commented out with a // at the beginning. Does that mean that I should not include it in any parts I make?
That means they are using the default value. You only need to include it if your parts do not want to use the defaults.

That means they are using the default value. You only need to include it if your parts do not want to use the defaults.

I find that odd since there is a second comment that says something like "1/3 of default" on the same line.

I find that odd since there is a second comment that says something like "1/3 of default" on the same line.

Why do you find that odd? There is a commented out line that says it is setting something to 1/3 of default. Since it is commented out the part uses the default. Obviously it was using 1/3 at one point but it was decided the part should use the default instead so the line was commented out...

Why do you find that odd? There is a commented out line that says it is setting something to 1/3 of default. Since it is commented out the part uses the default. Obviously it was using 1/3 at one point but it was decided the part should use the default instead so the line was commented out...

Yes, but I don't understand the point of leaving it like that. I guess it doesn't really matter either way, though.
